attributes.action: reconsider the reduction in funding for the City of Bristol College for the financial year 2010/11. This reduction will significantly affect the provision of courses to a wide range of vulnerable and disadvantaged communities in Bristol and South Gloucestershire, at a time when front-line support and qualifications are needed most to help those in work develop their skills and for the unemployed to get back to work.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The College has received total adult funding of £14 million in 2009/10. The position for 2010/11 is a proposed allocation of £11.6 million which is a reduction compared to this year’s funding of £2.4 million or 17%.
The proposed cuts will:

1 
Remove £1.4 million of funding for developmental learning in such things as aeronautical engineering, plumbing, electrical installation, care and teaching assistants.

2 
Remove a further £1 million of funding for LSC priority provision in areas such as construction, care and business

3 
Result in a direct loss of 3,000 adult training places 

4 
Lead to a devastating impact on local community provision including a threat to the viability of community/voluntary sector partners

5 
Contribute to a financial crisis for the College which is opening a new centre (the South Bristol Skills Academy) in August 2010 with mortgage servicing payments of £1.6 million per year

The overall impact of the reduction in income, without College action, shows a projected deficit of £6.1 million in 2010/11 and a further deterioration in 2011/12, which will have devastating impact on students / learners, staff jobs, businesses and the community.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with your local authority.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
